articles.headline: SAC’s Forceful Ways Shown in Massachusetts Citi Case
articles.snippet: In a case against Citigroup, the Massachusetts attorney general details how the indicted hedge fund relentlessly pursued an edge in stock trading.
articles.abstract: In a case against Citigroup, the Massachusetts attorney general details how the indicted hedge fund relentlessly pursued an edge in stock trading.
articles.lead_paragraph: The hedge fund was so desperate for an upper hand that four of its employees pleaded with a Wall Street analyst one morning to reveal private insights.
articles.byline: By Alexandra Stevenson and Ben Protess

articles.headline: After Fraud, Regulators Go After a Bank
articles.snippet: A government action against TD Bank, brought in connection with a customer’s Ponzi scheme, is noteworthy because it is so rare.
articles.abstract: A government action against TD Bank, brought in connection with a customer’s Ponzi scheme, is noteworthy because it is so rare.
articles.lead_paragraph: You can’t run a Ponzi scheme without a bank.

articles.headline: Twitter I.P.O. Filing Opens Books on High-Flier
articles.snippet: In making public its prospectus, Twitter sets the clock on one of the most anticipated stock sales of the year and shows how important mobile is to its business.
articles.abstract: In making public its prospectus, Twitter sets the clock on one of the most anticipated stock sales of the year and shows how important mobile is to its business.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated, 10 p.m. | SAN FRANCISCO — If Lady Gaga were to send a message to her 40 million followers on Twitter summarizing the company’s debut on Wall Street, it might very well say: “Twitter IPO. Mobile. Born This Way.”
articles.byline: By Vindu Goel and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Twitter Puts Numbers to Its I.P.O. Talk
articles.snippet: Investors can now look over Twitter’s figures to assess the company’s financial performance.
articles.abstract: Investors can now look over Twitter’s figures to assess the company’s financial performance.
articles.lead_paragraph: Millions of users seem to believe that Twitter has value.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Elders See Liabilities in Shutdown
articles.snippet: Senior Republican officials say the conservatives pushing the shutdown are undermining the party and its efforts to modernize, and helping President Obama just as his standing with the public has begun to slide.
articles.abstract: Senior Republican officials say the conservatives pushing the shutdown are undermining the party and its efforts to modernize, and helping President Obama just as his standing with the public has begun to slide.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The hard-line stance of Republican House members on the government shutdown is generating increasing anger among senior Republican officials, who say the small bloc of conservatives is undermining the party and helping President Obama just as the American people appeared to be losing confidence in him.

articles.headline: Goldman Banker With Year’s Top Tech Quarry
articles.snippet: Anthony J. Noto, a former Army Ranger and pro-football executive, and Goldman Sachs have won the most coveted tech banking assignment this year in leading the initial public offering of Twitter.
articles.abstract: Anthony J. Noto, a former Army Ranger and pro-football executive, and Goldman Sachs have won the most coveted tech banking assignment this year in leading the initial public offering of Twitter.
articles.lead_paragraph: Anthony J. Noto, a former Army Ranger and pro-football executive, may seem an odd fit among the cerebral recluses and flashy moneymen of the tech world.

articles.headline: Car Fire a Test for High-Flying Tesla
articles.snippet: Video shot by a motorist of a blazing Model S has led to a tumble for the company’s stock and questions about the safety of the car’s battery.
articles.abstract: Video shot by a motorist of a blazing Model S has led to a tumble for the company’s stock and questions about the safety of the car’s battery.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — It’s an automaker’s worst nightmare: graphic video footage of one of its cars engulfed in flames after an accident.

articles.headline: Jobs Report Becomes a Casualty of Shutdown
articles.snippet: The data vacuum left by the shuttered Labor Department has inspired other outfits that track the labor market to fight for analysts’ attention.
articles.abstract: The data vacuum left by the shuttered Labor Department has inspired other outfits that track the labor market to fight for analysts’ attention.
articles.lead_paragraph: On the first Friday morning of almost any other month, from the trading floors of Wall Street to the hushed hallways of the Federal Reserve, all the attention would be focused on two numbers: the latest government estimates for unemployment and job creation.

articles.headline: HTC Reports Its First Loss, but Samsung Shows Vigor
articles.snippet: Samsung Electronics probably benefited from memory chip sales, analysts said, while HTC said it would lose about $101 million after its flagship smartphone failed to catch on.
articles.abstract: Samsung Electronics probably benefited from memory chip sales, analysts said, while HTC said it would lose about $101 million after its flagship smartphone failed to catch on.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — The diverging fortunes of two of the leading smartphone providers in Asia were demonstrated on Friday when Samsung Electronics of South Korea predicted better-than-expected quarterly earnings, while HTC of Taiwan reported its first loss.

articles.headline: Gen. Vo Nguyen Giap, Who Ousted U.S. From Vietnam, Is Dead
articles.snippet: General Giap, whose victory at Dien Bien Phu forced France from Vietnam, later waged a long battle with the United States military that eventually sapped America’s political will to fight.
articles.abstract: General Giap, whose victory at Dien Bien Phu forced France from Vietnam, later waged a long battle with the United States military that eventually sapped America’s political will to fight.
articles.lead_paragraph: Vo Nguyen Giap, the relentless and charismatic North Vietnamese general whose campaigns drove both France and the United States out of Vietnam, died on Friday in Hanoi. He was believed to be 102.
